chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Eugene Irving Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-5TH Or 6TH Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with Walworth case 19CF414.
Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined at the discretion of the DOC.
Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 24 months on any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name.
Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommended treatment.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  Fine in the amount of $600.00. All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Eugene Irving Sr

defendant.name: Irving, Donald Eugene, Sr
defendant.address: 5533 West National Avenue ,202, West Milwaukee, WI 53214

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Eugene Irving Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Donald Eugene Irving Sr.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS with 137 days credit CONCURRENT to Walworth Case 19CF414; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1  YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION to be determined at the discretion of the DOC.

- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.  
- Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 24 months on any vehicle owned, operated, and titled in the defendant's name.
- Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, and comply with any recommended treatment.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Donald Eugene Irving not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense did not proceed with the scheduled bail bond hearing and proceeded with a status conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Eugene Irving in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris, appear by video.  Defendant Donald Eugene Irving in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person and Julie Knyszek appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Donald Eugene Irving in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Donald Eugene Irving in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donald Eugene Irving appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
